structure.unit: ARTICLE IB. STANDARDS FOR CREATION AND REVIEW OF BOARDS GENERALLY

text.section:
Sec. 2-11.39.1. Quorum.
Notwithstanding any other provision of the Code or of any resolution, a quorum for all County Boards shall consist of a majority of those persons duly appointed to the board, provided that at least one-half (½) of the full board membership has been appointed. It is expressly provided, however, that the quorum requirement for any board created or established pursuant to or of this Code (Community Council or Community Zoning Appeal Board) shall be four (4) members and that the quorum requirement for any board created or established pursuant to of this Code (Planning Advisory Board) shall be six (6) members.
